text: <@U0DTGSP8E|nilesh> has joined the channel
<@U0DTM911Q|clement> has joined the channel

Well...I'm struggling to fix a CipherInputStream unable to read last 16 bytes!!!!

anybody know a good fix for it?

(except: Don't use it)
might this help? <http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12645489/cipherinputstream-only-read-16-bytes-aes-java>

attachments.title: CipherInputStream only read 16 bytes (AES/Java)
attachments.text: I'm using CipherInputStream and CipherOutputStream to encrypt files using AES. encrypt(...) seems to be working fine, but my decrypt(...) function only decrypt the first 16 bytes of my files. Her...

text: wtf, no resource found for the svg victor should generate after I replaced it :confused:
Thx <@U053PPGDC>  but it didn't... I've tried so many others workaround that my mind is getting spin...
what are you trying to do?
Well I've encrypted image files on SD... I'm keeping them and decrypting them with AES and using CipherInputStream to decrypt and writing in a ByteArrayOutputStream
during the CipherInputStream reading on the last 16 bytes it raises an Exception: ava.io.IOException: Error while finalizing cipher
I'm using Cipher Instance with:
Cipher.getInstance("AES/CBC/PKCS5Padding", "BC")
I'm pretty sure the encryption using PKCS#5 padding
if I change with this: Cipher.getInstance("AES/CBC/NoPadding", "BC")
No Exception rise
but no decrypting happens
Bah!
Are you sure it’s properly padded at the input too?
I mean, is the input size a multiple of the block size? Cause that is a usual cause of an exception like this
Well I used openssl enc -aes-256-cbc  not using -nopad clause
and "All the block ciphers normally use PKCS#5 padding also known as standard block padding"

ok, usually projects use Gradle wrapper, it’s a tiny `jar` that actually downloads required version of real `Gradle` and then uses it
Probably the project you’re trying to build already contains one `gradlew`
if so — just launch it `./gradlew` from the project’s directory
